newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: South Korea seeks 12.8 pct budget rise for 1997.
newsitem.headline: South Korea seeks 12.8 pct budget rise for 1997.

text.p: South Korea's Finance and Economy Ministry said on Tuesday it would seek a balanced budget of 67.78 trillion won for next year, a 12.8 percent rise over this year's 60.11 trillion won.
The ministry plans to send the proposal to the cabinet for approval early on Tuesday.

A ministry statement said the budget was based on a government forecast that the gross domestic product (GDP) would grow by a real 6.5-7.0 percent in 1997 against this year's estimated 7.0-7.5 percent growth.
